$FED  The maximum unemployment in the FED severe adverse scenario hits 10% in Q3 2021. Unemployment hit 14.7% in April. Part of the FED mandate is 'to promote effectively the goals of maximum employment'. FED & Congress will likely to wait for May unemployment, but a major jobs program is coming. It will be the highlight of round two measures. When rumors emerge about the program look for value to get a sustainable bid. Finally market breadth will broaden.

At the intra-day low yesterday the SPX was 6% below the 200-week sma. 

Other instances during bull markets since 1978:

In 2016 and 2018 the 200-week sma held.

In 2011 the index bottomed 5.95% below the 200-week sma.

In 2004 the index bottomed  just below the 200-week sma.

In 1997 and 1998 the index never came close to the 200-week sma.

In 1990 the index bottomed about 2% below the 200-week sma.
 
In 1987 the index bottomed right on the 200-week sma.

In 1982 the index bottomed 11% below the 200-week sma.

In 1980 the index bottomed 6.3% below the 200-week sma.

In 1978 the index bottomed 5.5% below the 200-week sma.

The low yesterday was within the range of previous deviations (all) from the 200-week sma during bull markets. Additionally, it is within the range of previous deviations from a a rising 200-week sma like in 1980 and 1982.

HOW LOW CAN $NFLX GO? ---

Netflix is down 39% from the 2018 high and it is down 33% from the 2019 high. It seems like a lot, particularly if you were a buyer at either one of those highs, but a look at the long term charts shows that it was about time.

Netflix has not touched the 26-month sma or the 200-week sma since the beginning of 2013. The momentum / leadership of the stock has been unprecedented. Even $AAPL tested both moving averages in 2016 and in 2018. 

Currently, the 36-month sma is just two points below the current price and the 200-week sma comes in 221.47. It is our view that maximum decline potential is the 200-week sma which coincides with the 2018 low.
